intro: Schomburgkia elata, commonly known as the showy orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Schomburgkia elata features long, slender pseudobulbs and produces pendulous inflorescences with showy, fragrant blooms. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for both ornamental gardening and botanical study.
